CatDescriptText: Frances Clark, 1402 Montier Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "I don't think that there will be an economic depression because things are going to pick up. I believe Ike's commitment to be the truth.  And from the person I work for I've learned that the stock market already is going up."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frances Clark wearing earrings and tweed coat with dark stripe on collar, holding bag and handbag over left wrist, standing in front of marble facade with store windows on either side, shoe display with sign that reads "Shoes..." on left, and furniture on right
